result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse L. Miracle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Provide Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(3)(b)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 167 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Comply with registration requirements.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 18 months w/conditions; credit for 167 days served if revoked; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.
from deft.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft waives right to counsel.  Deft's motion to show jurisdiction and dismiss.  Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 5/8/17 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Set for court trial.  ADA Drees states she spoke with deft off the record about an offer that he wants a week to consider.  CT continued to 4/4/17 at 2pm.  Bond continued.
